locale.message: DNB URN
This plugin enables the assignment of Uniform Resource Names according to the DNB to monographs in OMP.
DNB URN Plugin Settings

Please configure the DNB URN plug-in to be able to manage and use DNB URNs in OMP. A DNB URN is composed of a prefix and a Namespace Specific String, which can both be configured for each press. A check digit is added automatically.
URN Plugin Settings Updated
DNB URN Prefix
The URN Prefix is assigned by the DNB (e.g. CrossRef) and is in the format urn:nbn:de followed by one ore more subnamespaces.
The DNB URN prefix is mandatory and must be in the form urn:nbn:de followed by one ore more subnamespaces.
Namespace Specific String
A pattern to generate a Namespace Specific String is required.

A DNB Namespace Specific String starts with a hyphen '-', followed by an alphanumerical string (allowed characters are a-z, 0-9, hyphen '-' and period '.'). It must be unique among all publishing objects with the same URN prefix.
Use the pattern entered below to generate Namespace Specific Strings. Use %p for press initials and %m for the monograph unique id.
For example, -press%ppub%m could create a DNB URN such as urn:nbn:de:espsub-pressESPpub100
Use default patterns.
%p.%m for monographs.
Please enter the Namespace Specific String pattern for monographs.
Reassign DNB URNs

If you change your DNB URN configuration, DNB URNs that have already been assigned will not be affected. Once the DNB URN configuration is saved, use this button to clear all existing URNs so that the new settings will take effect with existing publication formats.
